tk.ttkExtra module¶

ttkExtra adds on to existing ttk classes and functions By doing so, it is easier to accomplish common tasks, such as centering a Tk() or Toplevel() instance It also creates custom, frequently used classes

class tk.ttkExtra.Calltip(widget, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.ttkExtra.Tooltip

Maintained for backwards-compatibility

class tk.ttkExtra.EventMenu(widget, commands, *args, **options)[source]¶

Bases: Tkinter.Menu

Creates a Menu on a widget based off of events Commands are in the format [{‘label’: label, ‘command’: command, ‘type’: type, ‘accelerator’: accelerator}, ...] For separators, simply use {‘type’: ‘separator’}

addItem(**options)[source]¶

Adds a item to the menu

Sets the commands

Shows the window

class tk.ttkExtra.LabelledScale(master=None, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWidget

Creates a Scale with a Label attached to it Supported options: font, fg, bg, command, edit, orientation, length, from_, to, type, default, round, binding

Notes on arguments:
command must return an integer, floating-point number, or Boolean

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

class tk.ttkExtra.Tooltip(widget, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Creates a window similar to IDLE’s tool-tips Supported options: widget, text, fg, bg, background, font, delay, event = binding, events = bindings, leave, offsetX, offset, condition, cleanup

Argument Notes: condition is a BooleanVar instance

static add(widget, **options)[source]¶

Creates a tooltip on the widget, using the specified options

hide()[source]¶

Hides the tooltip

show(event)[source]¶

Shows the tooltip
